meanings.definition: To make impure by adding inferior or tainted substances.
meanings.sent1: The chef adulterates the soup by adding expired ingredients.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to adulterate the medicine with harmful chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf decided to adulterate the cookie dough with salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The fake smile adulterates her true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The polluted river water adulterates the purity of the lake.

meanings.sent1: Greed can adulterate a person's morals over time.
meanings.sent2: Power can easily adulterate the intentions of even the most well-meaning individuals.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy tried to adulterate the clean laundry by rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The toxic relationship slowly adulterates her sense of self-worth.
meanings.sent5: The dishonesty of the politician adulterates the trust of the citizens.

meanings.definition: To alter or tamper with something in a harmful way.
meanings.sent1: The hacker tried to adulterate the company's database by inserting malicious code.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to adulterate the evidence during the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student attempted to adulterate the teacher's lesson plan by switching the pages.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds adulterate the calm of the peaceful night.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's tag adulterates the beauty of the historic building.
